name: Value Proposition Framework Test Data
description: Representative test instances covering typical, edge, boundary, and invalid cases

typical.description: Normal range, common scenarios - 60% of test data

instances.vpf:problemStatement: Mid-market SaaS companies struggle with unpredictable customer churn when trying to retain high-value accounts, which results in 20-30% annual revenue loss and difficulty forecasting growth.

instances.name: Mid-market SaaS Company
instances.vpf:segmentDescription: SaaS companies with 50-500 employees, $10M-$100M ARR, experiencing 30-50% year-over-year growth

instances.vpf:painDescription: Customer Success teams manually analyze spreadsheets of usage data, support tickets, and renewal dates to identify at-risk accounts
instances.vpf:customerImpact: CS managers spend 10-15 hours per week on manual analysis, reducing time available for actual customer engagement

vpf:quantifiedImpact.unitText: hours per week per CS manager

instances.name: PredictiveCS Platform
instances.vpf:solutionDescription: AI-powered customer success platform that automatically analyzes customer health signals, predicts churn risk 90 days in advance, and recommends proactive interventions
instances.vpf:coreFunctionality: Automated churn prediction, health scoring, intervention recommendations, success playbooks

instances.vpf:featureDescription: Machine learning algorithm that analyzes 50+ customer health signals and generates churn risk scores updated in real-time

instances.vpf:benefitDescription: Reduce customer churn by 25-40%, retaining $2M-$5M in annual recurring revenue
instances.vpf:measurementMethod: Track churn rate before and after implementation over 12-month period

instances.vpf:differentiatorDescription: Proprietary AI algorithm predicts churn 90 days earlier than traditional rule-based systems
instances.vpf:competitiveAdvantage: 90-day advance warning vs 30-day industry standard enables proactive vs reactive interventions

instances.vpf:primaryStatement: For mid-market SaaS companies who struggle with unpredictable customer churn, our PredictiveCS platform provides proactive churn prevention and $2M+ in retained annual revenue, unlike traditional reactive CS tools, because our proprietary algorithm predicts churn 90 days earlier with 95% accuracy.
instances.vpf:targetCustomerDescription: Mid-market SaaS companies ($10M-$100M ARR) with growth ambitions
instances.vpf:keyBenefits: Reduce churn by 25-40%, retain $2M-$5M annually, increase CS team productivity by 50%
instances.vpf:uniqueDifferentiators: 90-day early churn prediction, 95% accuracy, automated intervention recommendations

edge.description: Boundary values, unusual but valid scenarios - 20% of test data

instances.vpf:problemStatement: Boutique financial advisory firms struggle with rapidly changing regulatory compliance requirements when trying to serve international clients, which results in potential fines and loss of operating licenses.

vpf:marketSize.description: Small niche market but high severity

instances.name: Micro Enterprise
instances.vpf:segmentDescription: Very small businesses with 5-10 employees, experiencing problem but limited budget
instances.comment: Edge case: customer has problem but low willingness to pay

instances.vpf:benefitDescription: Avoid regulatory fines that could range from $50K to $5M

vpf:quantifiedValue.description: Wide range reflects uncertainty in fine amounts - edge case for value quantification

instances.vpf:differentiatorDescription: Only solution in market addressing this specific niche problem
instances.comment: Edge case: blue ocean opportunity but small market size

boundary.description: At constraint limits, minimum/maximum values - 10% of test data

instances.vpf:problemStatement: Freelance consultants struggle with sporadic client communication when trying to manage multiple projects, which results in occasional missed deadlines.
instances.comment: Boundary case: minimal severity and frequency, barely meets threshold for viable problem

instances.name: Minimal MVP
instances.comment: Boundary case: bare minimum solution with single core function
Boundary case: minimal quantifiable benefit, barely justifies solution cost

instances.vpf:primaryStatement: For freelancers who occasionally miss deadlines, our reminder app provides basic notifications.
instances.comment: Boundary case: barely complete value proposition, missing competitive context and differentiation

invalid.description: Violates rules and constraints - 10% of test data for validation testing

instances.expectedValidationError: Problem must have at least one PainPoint
instances.comment: Invalid: violates business rule requiring PainPoints

instances.expectedValidationError: Problem must be validated by at least one ValidationEvidence

instances.name: Generic Solution
instances.expectedValidationError: Solution must have at least one Differentiator
instances.comment: Invalid: violates business rule requiring differentiation
Invalid: quantifiable benefit without quantified value

relationship_scenarios.description: Test complex relationship patterns and cardinality

instances.description: Full value chain from Problem through Solution to ValueProposition

graph.comment: Tests complete graph connectivity from problem identification through to value proposition articulation

instances.description: Single customer with multiple stakeholder roles
Single solution addressing multiple related problems

structure.comment: Tests 1..* cardinality of solution addressing multiple problems

scenarios.name: Startup Value Proposition Development
scenarios.description: Early-stage startup defining their value proposition for first time
steps: Identify target customer through customer discovery interviews
Document problems through problem validation research
Map pain points across functional, economic, emotional, social dimensions
Validate problem with 20+ customer interviews
Design solution addressing core pain points
Define key differentiators vs incumbents
Articulate value proposition
Create messaging framework
Test messaging with target customers

scenarios.name: Product-Market Fit Assessment
scenarios.description: Existing company evaluating product-market fit for new market segment
steps: Analyze current value proposition for existing segment
Research new target segment characteristics
Identify if same problems apply or need redefinition
Assess if existing solution addresses new segment's pain points
Evaluate if differentiators matter to new segment
Adapt value proposition and messaging for new segment
Validate with pilot customers in new segment
expectedOutcomes: Understanding of solution gaps for new segment

scenarios.name: Competitive Repositioning
scenarios.description: Company responding to new competitive threat by sharpening differentiation
steps: Analyze competitive alternative entering market
Identify their differentiators and positioning
Reassess own differentiators and defensibility
Identify solution gaps or weaknesses vs competitor
Enhance features or capabilities to maintain advantage
Sharpen value proposition to emphasize unique strengths
Update messaging framework with competitive battlecards
